intro: Senecio laticostatus, commonly known as the broad-costate senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features succulent, ribbed stems and fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio laticostatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
